Package core

Interface HlaLauncherManager

  • public interface HlaLauncherManager
    Manager used to manage HlaLaunchers.

    This class is ThreadSafe as defined by Java Concurrency in Practice, see jcip.net.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getHlaLaunchers

        java.util.List<HlaLauncher> getHlaLaunchers()
        Gets a list of all HlaLaunchers within interest, both local and remote. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of HlaLaunchers

      • getAllHlaLaunchers

        java.util.List<HlaLauncher> getAllHlaLaunchers()
        Gets a list of all HlaLaunchers, both local and remote. HlaLaunchers not within interest are also included. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of all HlaLaunchers

      • getLocalHlaLaunchers

        java.util.List<HlaLauncher> getLocalHlaLaunchers()
        Gets a list of local HlaLaunchers within interest. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of local HlaLaunchers

      • getRemoteHlaLaunchers

        java.util.List<HlaLauncher> getRemoteHlaLaunchers()
        Gets a list of remote HlaLaunchers within interest. The list is a copy that is allowed to be altered.
        Returns:
        a list of remote HlaLaunchers

      • getLauncherByHlaInstanceName

        HlaLauncher getLauncherByHlaInstanceName​(java.lang.String hlaInstanceName)
        Find a HlaLauncher with the given HLA instance name. If none is found, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        hlaInstanceName - the HLA instance name of the HlaLauncher to find
        Returns:
        the specified HlaLauncher, or null if not found.

      • getLauncherByHlaInstanceHandle

        HlaLauncher getLauncherByHlaInstanceHandle​(byte[] encodedHlaInstanceHandle)
        Find a HlaLauncher with the given HLA instance name. If none is found, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        encodedHlaInstanceHandle - the encoded HLA instance handle of the HlaLauncher to find
        Returns:
        the specified HlaLauncher, or null if not found.

      • createLocalHlaLauncher

        HlaLauncher createLocalHlaLauncher()
                            throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                   HlaInternalException,
                                   HlaRtiException,
                                   HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                   HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Creates a new HlaLauncher, and sets all Create attributes.
        Returns:
        Returns a new local HlaLauncher.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • createLocalHlaLauncher

        HlaLauncher createLocalHlaLauncher​(java.lang.String hlaInstanceName)
                            throws HlaIllegalInstanceNameException,
                                   HlaInstanceNameInUseException,
                                   HlaNotConnectedException,
                                   HlaInternalException,
                                   HlaRtiException,
                                   HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                   HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Creates a new HlaLauncher with a specified HLA instance name, and sets all Create attributes.
        Parameters:
        hlaInstanceName - the HLA instance name to register for this instance
        Returns:
        Returns a new local HlaLauncher.
        Throws:
        HlaIllegalInstanceNameException - if the name is illegal
        HlaInstanceNameInUseException - if the name is already in use
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaLauncher

        HlaLauncher deleteLocalHlaLauncher​(HlaLauncher launcher)
                            throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                   HlaInternalException,
                                   HlaRtiException,
                                   HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                   HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaLauncher and removes it from the federation.
        Parameters:
        launcher - The HlaLauncher to delete
        Returns:
        the HlaLauncher deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaLauncher

        HlaLauncher deleteLocalHlaLauncher​(HlaLauncher launcher,
                                   HlaTimeStamp timestamp)
                            throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                   HlaInternalException,
                                   HlaRtiException,
                                   HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                   HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaLauncher and removes it from the federation with a specified timestamp
        Parameters:
        launcher - The HlaLauncher to delete
        timestamp - timestamp when the instance was removed.
        Returns:
        the HlaLauncher deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaLauncher

        HlaLauncher deleteLocalHlaLauncher​(HlaLauncher launcher,
                                   HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                            throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                   HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                   HlaInternalException,
                                   HlaRtiException,
                                   HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                   HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaLauncher and removes it from the federation at a specified logical time.
        Parameters:
        launcher - The HlaLauncher to delete
        logicalTime - The logical time when the instance was removed.
        Returns:
        the HlaLauncher deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • deleteLocalHlaLauncher

        HlaLauncher deleteLocalHlaLauncher​(HlaLauncher launcher,
                                   HlaTimeStamp timestamp,
                                   HlaLogicalTime logicalTime)
                            throws HlaNotConnectedException,
                                   HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException,
                                   HlaInternalException,
                                   HlaRtiException,
                                   HlaSaveInProgressException,
                                   HlaRestoreInProgressException
        Deletes a local HlaLauncher and removes it from the federation with a specified timestamp at a specified logical time.
        Parameters:
        launcher - The HlaLauncher to delete
        timestamp - timestamp when the instance was removed.
        logicalTime - The logical time when the instance was removed.
        Returns:
        the HlaLauncher deleted, null if it did not exist.
        Throws:
        HlaNotConnectedException - if the federate is not connected
        HlaInvalidLogicalTimeException - if the logical time is invalid
        HlaInternalException - on internal errors
        HlaRtiException - on exception from the RTI
        HlaSaveInProgressException - if a federation save is in progress
        HlaRestoreInProgressException - if a federation restore is in progress

      • addHlaLauncherManagerListener

        void addHlaLauncherManagerListener​(HlaLauncherManagerListener managerListener)
        Add an HlaLauncher manager listener.
        Parameters:
        managerListener - listener to add

      • removeHlaLauncherManagerListener

        void removeHlaLauncherManagerListener​(HlaLauncherManagerListener managerListener)
        Remove an HlaLauncher manager listener.
        Parameters:
        managerListener - listener to remove

      • addHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceListener

        void addHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceListener​(HlaLauncherListener listener)
        Add a listener that will automatically be added to all instances of HlaLauncher (Both local and remote). The listener is notified when any attribute of an instance of HlaLauncher is updated. The listener is also called when an interaction is sent to an instance of HlaLauncher. All listeners will automatically be removed when an instance is removed. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add.

      • removeHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceListener

        void removeHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceListener​(HlaLauncherListener listener)
        Remove a listener from the set of listeners that are automatically added to new instances of HlaLauncher. Note: The listener will not be removed from already existing instances of HlaLauncher. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.

      • addHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceValueListener

        void addHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceValueListener​(HlaLauncherValueListener valueListener)
        Add a valueListener that will automatically be added to all instances of HlaLauncher (Both local and remote). The Valuelistener is notified when any attribute of an instance of HlaLauncher is updated. Note that the attribute values that are notified are not guaranteed to be the latest available values for that attribute. All listeners will automatically be removed when an instance is removed. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        valueListener - The valueListener to add.

      • removeHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceValueListener

        void removeHlaLauncherDefaultInstanceValueListener​(HlaLauncherValueListener valueListener)
        Remove a valueListener from the set of listeners that are automatically added to new instances of HlaLauncher. Note: The valueListener will not be removed from already existing instances of HlaLauncher. This method is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        valueListener - The valueListener to remove.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the HlaLauncher manager. The manager is enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When the HlaLauncher manager is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable the HlaLauncher manager, otherwise false

      • setEnabledIfAvailableInFom

        void setEnabledIfAvailableInFom()
        Enables the HlaLauncher manager if it is available in the FOM at runtime. The manager is enabled by default. The state can only be changed when not connected. When the HlaLauncher manager is disabled it will act as disconnected, ie throws HlaNotConnectedException.

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Check if the HlaLauncher manager is actually enabled when connected. An HlaLauncher manager may be disabled with the setEnabled(false) function, or it may be configured as if available in the FOM by the setEnabledIfAvailableInFom() function and then not available in the FOM at runtime.

        This method should only be used when connected, it will always return false when not connected.

        Returns:
        true if connected and the HlaLauncher manager is enabled.
